column4: Hi, why in ubuntu i cant get full internet speed but in windows work great? what i should do?
what are u using to base ur internet speed off of
what website you testing ur speeds with
i dont understand your question. sorry for my bad english xd
so u r testing with speedtest.net... ok  how different are the results zul0
maybe ur NIC is not functioning in full duplex
are you in ubuntu right now?
let me check my card model. i think it has 100mbps support
Are you using Ubuntu right now?
go to the terminal and type this:   dmesg | grep -i duplex
hard to say what could cause the internet speed to test slower between OSes... maybe for some reason the speeds arent slower but speedtest is thinking it is
maybe the cause is my driver?
doubt it
thanks for your help. maybe is my router...or something..xd
doubt it.. the router doesnt care about OS... what kind of network card is it suppose to be in the computer?
here are the laptop speficications http://www.asus.com/Notebooks/Superior_Mobility/U50Vg/#specifications
looking now
what does windows see the network card as...what driver does it use etc.
